title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0084

segments.en: And where are we going today, Erika?
Alright, to the pharmacy or drugstore?
segments.cn: 好的，是去药店还是药房？

segments.en: Or also in British English, sometimes people say the chemist.
segments.cn: 在英式英语中，有时人们称之为药剂师。

segments.en: So as you know, at the pharmacy you get medicine, but there are certain vocabulary words that are related to this place that we need to learn.
segments.cn: 正如你所知，在药店你可以拿到药，但有一些与这个地方相关的词汇我们需要学习。

segments.en: So we're going to learn some vocabulary about medicine and also some interesting phrases.
segments.cn: 所以我们要学习一些关于药物的词汇和一些有趣的短语。

segments.en: So before we listen to the dialogue, let's take a look at vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 在我们听对话之前，先来看一下词汇预览。

segments.en: We're going to look at two words today that you'll hear in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 今天我们要看两个在对话中会听到的词。

segments.en: Also the abbreviation for this is MG.
So there are 100 milligrams in a gram.
And it's very common to be used with medicine, right?
segments.cn: 而且它在药物中非常常用，对吗？
你买药是以毫克为单位的。

segments.en: Okay, and what's our next word?
Okay, so at the pharmacy or at the supermarket, sometimes the cashier will ask for a price check.
segments.cn: 好的，在药店或超市，有时收银员会要求进行价格查询。

segments.en: And that is the action of checking to find out the price.
segments.cn: 这就是检查价格的动作。

segments.en: With this, I think we're ready now to listen to our dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 有了这个，我想我们现在可以第一次听我们的对话了。

segments.en: And let's see what our shopper is buying at the pharmacy.
segments.cn: 让我们看看我们的顾客在药店买了什么。

segments.en: Yes, I need this prescription, please.
Would you prefer this in capsule or tablet?
Okay, you should take one capsule three times a day.
segments.cn: 好的，你应该每天服用一粒胶囊三次。

segments.en: Be sure not to take it on an empty stomach.
And also, don't ever mix it with alcohol.
segments.cn: 另外，绝不要与酒精混合。

segments.en: It's not the first time I'm taking this.
segments.cn: 我不是第一次服用这个。

segments.en: Okay, anything else I can get you?
segments.cn: 好的，还有其他我可以帮你的吗？

segments.en: Can I also get some eye drops and some condoms?
segments.cn: 我还可以要一些眼药水和避孕套吗？

segments.en: Darn, condoms aren't registered in our system.
segments.cn: 糟糕，避孕套在我们的系统中没有注册。

segments.en: Just hang on there a sec.
Can I get a price check on Fun Times ribbed condoms, please?
segments.cn: 我可以查一下Fun Times的带纹避孕套的价格吗？

segments.en: A little bit embarrassing that she asked for a price check on these condoms, right?
segments.cn: 她要求查这些避孕套的价格有点尴尬，对吧？

segments.en: It seems like every time you have to buy something embarrassing at the pharmacy, there's a million people watching you.
segments.cn: 每次你在药店买一些尴尬的东西时，总有一堆人看着你。

segments.en: Well, let's take a look at some of those words that we were talking about related to medicine in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看一些与药物相关的词汇。

segments.en: Alright, well the first word, a prescription.
Alright, so what is a prescription?
Well, a prescription is a note from your doctor explaining what medicine you need.
segments.cn: 处方是你医生写的说明你需要什么药的便条。

segments.en: So this note from your doctor is necessary to buy that medicine, right?
segments.cn: 所以这张医生的便条是购买药物所必需的，对吗？

segments.en: Well, this shopper was getting some medicine and, well, the chemist or the pharmacist asked if he wanted it in capsules or tablets.
segments.cn: 这个顾客在拿药时，药剂师问他想要胶囊还是片剂。

segments.en: So let's look at those two words.
segments.cn: 所以我们来看这两个词。

segments.en: Now, a capsule is like a small tube, right?
segments.cn: 胶囊就像一个小管子，对吗？

segments.en: Yeah, it's a form of a pill.
segments.cn: 是的，它是一种药丸的形式。

segments.en: And it's shaped like a tube with the medicine inside.
segments.cn: 它的形状像一个管子，里面装着药。

segments.en: Inside, and it's covered in plastic, right?
segments.cn: 里面是药，外面包裹着塑料，对吗？

segments.en: And the tablet... Is like a pill that is round and flat.
segments.cn: 而片剂... 就像一个圆形扁平的药丸。

segments.en: Both are the same thing, basically, but just different presentations.
segments.cn: 基本上是同样的东西，只是不同的形式。

segments.en: It's easier maybe for some people to swallow a capsule.
segments.cn: 对某些人来说，吞下胶囊可能更容易。

segments.en: I don't know, I think so.
Well... Because sometimes tablets are a little bit like big circles and it's hard to swallow.
segments.cn: 嗯... 因为有时片剂有点像大圆圈，吞下去很难。

segments.en: Yeah, and I guess capsules are smoother.
But we're not pharmacists, so let's move on and focus on the language, which is what we do know about.
segments.cn: 但我们不是药剂师，所以让我们继续，专注于我们知道的语言。

segments.en: So the pharmacist warned the patient not to take too much medicine, right?
segments.cn: 所以药剂师警告病人不要服用过多的药，对吗？

segments.en: Okay, so to overdose, like you said... Is to take too much medicine and get really sick or even die.
segments.cn: 好吧，过量，正如你所说……就是服用过多药物，导致非常生病甚至死亡。

segments.en: So if you overdose on medicine, it could be bad for you instead of good.
segments.cn: 所以如果你药物过量，对你来说可能是坏事，而不是好事。

segments.en: And what about our last word for today?
segments.cn: 那我们今天的最后一个词呢？

segments.en: Well, the shopper also asked for some eye drops.
segments.cn: 嗯，购物者还要求一些眼药水。

segments.en: So this is medicine for your eyes?
segments.cn: 所以这是给你眼睛的药吗？

segments.en: Yeah, usually liquid, like water that you put in your eyes.
segments.cn: 是的，通常是液体，像水一样放入眼睛。

segments.en: So I think now with this medicine language clear, we can listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 所以我想现在这个药物语言清楚了，我们可以再听一次对话。

segments.en: But it's gonna be slowed down a little bit.
That'll help us understand these phrases just a little bit better.
segments.cn: 这将帮助我们更好地理解这些短语。

segments.en: Would you prefer this in capsule or tablet?
Okay, you should take one capsule three times a day.
segments.cn: 好的，你应该每天服用一颗胶囊三次。

segments.en: Be sure not to take it on an empty stomach.
And also, don't ever mix it with alcohol.
segments.cn: 而且，绝不要与酒精混合。

segments.en: It's not the first time I'm taking this.
segments.cn: 我不是第一次服用这个。

segments.en: Okay, anything else I can get you?
segments.cn: 好的，还有其他我可以帮你的吗？

segments.en: Can I get some eye drops and some condoms?
segments.cn: 我可以要一些眼药水和避孕套吗？

segments.en: Darn condoms aren't registered in our system.
segments.cn: 可恶，避孕套在我们的系统中没有注册。

segments.en: Just hang on there a sec.
Can I get a price check on Fun Times ribbed condoms, please?
segments.cn: 我可以查一下Fun Times的带纹避孕套的价格吗？

segments.en: Okay, so now it's time for us to take a look at some of the phrases that we saw in this dialogue in Putting It Together.
segments.cn: 好的，现在是我们看看在“整合”中看到的一些短语的时候了。

segments.en: We're going to look at two phrases here and we're going to see how we can use them in different situations.
segments.cn: 我们将看两个短语，看看如何在不同情况下使用它们。

segments.en: The pharmacist warned, be sure not to take it on an empty stomach.
segments.cn: 药剂师警告，一定要在饭后服用。

segments.en: Okay, so be sure not to.
So what does he mean by this?
He just means don't do this.
segments.cn: 他只是意味着不要这样做。

segments.en: So don't take the medicine without eating.
segments.cn: 所以不要在没吃东西的情况下服用药物。

segments.en: We can mix it up a little bit.
segments.cn: 我们可以稍微变换一下。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to some examples of how we can use this in different situations.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不听一些如何在不同情况下使用这个的例子。

segments.en: Be sure not to forget your umbrella.
I told him to be sure not to do anything stupid, but he did.
segments.cn: 我告诉他一定不要做任何愚蠢的事，但他做了。

segments.en: So Marco, why should we say be sure not to instead of don't?
segments.cn: 所以Marco，我们为什么要说“一定要不”而不是“不要”？

segments.en: I think don't sounds more like an order, but very direct.
segments.cn: 我觉得“不要”听起来更像是命令，但非常直接。

segments.en: Maybe be sure not to is a little bit softer, a little bit more friendly.
segments.cn: 也许“一定要不”稍微柔和一点，更友好一点。
现在是我们的最后一个短语。

segments.en: So the pharmacist in the end wanted to check for the price and he said, just hang on there a sec.
segments.cn: 所以药剂师最后想检查价格，他说，稍等一下。

segments.en: What does he mean by hang on?
segments.cn: 他所说的“等一下”是什么意思？

segments.en: It's an informal way of saying wait.
segments.cn: 这是一种非正式的说法。

segments.en: It's also a little bit more friendly than just saying wait.
segments.cn: 这也比单纯说“等”更友好一点。

segments.en: And we can change the time a little bit, right?
segments.cn: 我们可以稍微改变一下时间，对吧？

segments.en: So you can say hang on a second.
What about hang on an hour?
Well, maybe if you're telling someone to wait for an hour, just hang on there for an hour.
segments.cn: 嗯，也许如果你告诉某人等一个小时，等一下，我很快就到。

segments.en: Yeah, but I guess it's more common hang on a minute.
segments.cn: 是的，但我想更常见的是等一分钟。

segments.en: Maybe for shorter periods of time.
segments.cn: 也许适用于较短的时间。

segments.en: So what these phrases, I think now we can use them in different circumstances, obviously, not only in the pharmacy.
segments.cn: 所以这些短语，我想现在我们可以在不同情况下使用，显然，不仅仅是在药店。

segments.en: And well, let's listen to our dialogue for the last time.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们最后再听一次对话。

segments.en: Would you prefer this in capsule or tablet?
You should take one capsule three times a day.
segments.cn: 你应该每天服用一颗胶囊三次。

segments.en: Be sure not to take it on an empty stomach and also don't ever mix it with alcohol.
segments.cn: 一定要在饭后服用，也不要和酒精混合。

segments.en: It's not the first time I'm taking this.
Anything else I can get you?
segments.cn: 还有其他我可以帮你的吗？

segments.en: Can I also get some eye drops and some condoms?
segments.cn: 我还可以要一些眼药水和避孕套吗？

segments.en: Darn condoms aren't registered in our system.
segments.cn: 可恶，避孕套在我们的系统中没有注册。

segments.en: Just hang on there a sec.
Can I get a price check on Fun Times ribbed condoms, please?
segments.cn: 我可以查一下有趣时光的带纹避孕套的价格吗？

segments.en: So with medicine, an interesting thing comes up, right?
segments.cn: 所以关于药物，有个有趣的事情，对吧？

segments.en: A lot of people think that you eat medicine.
But in English, you always take medicine.
segments.cn: 但在英语中，你总是说服药。

segments.en: So you never can say, oh, I ate my medicine yesterday.
segments.cn: 所以你不能说，哦，我昨天吃了药。

segments.en: It always has to be, I took my medicine.
Now, an interesting thing in the United States, for example, it's very hard to get medicine without a prescription.
segments.cn: 现在，在美国，有个有趣的事情，比如说，没有处方很难买到药。

segments.en: So we always talk about prescription medicine and OTC medicine or over-the-counter medicine.
segments.cn: 所以我们总是谈论处方药和非处方药。

segments.en: Is medicine you can just buy without that prescription or note from your doctor.
segments.cn: 是你可以直接购买的药，不需要医生的处方或说明。

segments.en: So for example, if you have a headache, you can go to the pharmacy and buy aspirin.
segments.cn: 比如说，如果你头痛，你可以去药店买阿司匹林。

segments.en: But prescription medicine, you can't get it without the doctor's note.
segments.cn: 但处方药，你没有医生的说明是买不到的。

segments.en: And like you said, in America, you almost have to have a prescription for everything.
segments.cn: 就像你说的，在美国，几乎所有东西都需要处方。

segments.en: Which is strange because people can overdose on aspirin.
segments.cn: 这很奇怪，因为人们可以对阿司匹林过量。

segments.en: So tell us how medicine and pharmacies work in your countries.
segments.cn: 所以告诉我们你们国家的药物和药店是如何运作的。

segments.en: And also, if you have questions or comments, our website, EnglishPod.com, is always open and ready for you.
segments.cn: 如果你有问题或评论，我们的网站EnglishPod.com始终开放，随时欢迎你。

segments.en: Well, thanks for downloading this lesson, you guys.
segments.cn: 好吧，谢谢你们下载这节课。
